intro: Schuebleria intermedia, commonly known as the silverleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pale yellow to orange and are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Schuebleria intermedia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
